ci:config:get.description:
get a CI config var
Examples:

    $ heroku ci:config:get RAILS_ENV
    test

shell.name: shell
shell.description: output config var in shell format

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

ci:config.description:
display CI config vars
Example:

    $ heroku ci:config --app murmuring-headland-14719 --json

shell.name: shell
shell.description: output config vars in shell format

json.name: json
json.description: output config vars in json format

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

ci:config:set.description:
set CI config vars
Examples:

    $ heroku ci:config:set RAILS_ENV=test
    Setting test config vars... done

    RAILS_ENV: test

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

ci:config:unset.description:
unset CI config vars
Examples:

    $ heroku ci:config:uset RAILS_ENV
    Unsetting RAILS_ENV... done

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

ci:debug.description:
opens an interactive test debugging session with the contents of the current directory
Example:

    $ heroku ci:debug
    Preparing source... done
    Creating test run... done
    Running setup and attaching to test dyno...

~ $

no-setup.name: no-setup
no-setup.description: start test dyno without running test-setup

no-cache.name: no-cache
no-cache.description: start test run with an empty cache

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

ci.description:
show the most recent runs
display the most recent CI runs for the given pipeline

  Example:

    $ heroku ci --app murmuring-headland-14719

watch.name: watch
watch.description: keep running and watch for new and update tests

json.name: json
json.description: output run info in json format

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

    $ heroku ci --app murmuring-headland-14719

ci:info.description:
test run information
show the status of a specific test run

  Example:

    $ heroku ci:info 1288 --app murmuring-headland-14719

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

args.name: number
args.description: the test run number to show

ci:last.description:
get the results of the last run
looks for the most recent run and returns the output of that run

  Example:

  $ heroku ci:last --app murmuring-headland-14719

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

ci:migrate-manifest.description:
app-ci.json is deprecated. Run this command to migrate to app.json with an environments key.
Example:

    $ heroku ci:migrate-manifest
    Writing app.json file... done
    Deleting app-ci.json file... done
    Please check the contents of your app.json before committing to your repo
    You're all set! ðŸŽ‰.

ci:open.description:
open the Dashboard version of Heroku CI
opens a browser to view the Dashboard version of Heroku CI

    Example:

    $ heroku ci:open --app murmuring-headland-14719

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

ci:rerun.description:
rerun tests against current directory
uploads the contents of the current directory, using git archive, to Heroku and runs the tests

  Example:

    $ heroku ci:rerun 985 --app murmuring-headland-14719

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use

ci:run.description:
run tests against current directory
uploads the contents of the current directory to Heroku and runs the tests

  Example:

    $ heroku ci:run --app murmuring-headland-14719

remote.name: remote
remote.description: git remote of app to use
